PageTitle: set service-mode port-extended(Virtual access AP-ID view)
FuncDef:
The set service-mode port-extended command extends the number of subcard interfaces on an AP.
The undo set service-mode port-extended command cancels the number of extended subcard interfaces on an AP.
By default, subcard interfaces are not extended.
Examples: Warning:This command will reset all the NPU, causing service interruptions. Please exercise caution when running this command. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, the maximum number of subcard interfaces that can be used on an AP is limited. To extend the number of subcard interfaces on an AP, run the set service-mode port-extended command. After the command is run, all the subcard interfaces on an AP can be used. This command applies only to CSFP subcards.
Precautions
After the command is run, the interface boards of the AP are powered off, causing all subcards to be powered off and then on.
The command can be successfully run in the AP view only when the AP is an X2 device and the interface board is a 240/480/1T.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
